faq.title: Common Questions
faq.q1Title: Will this work with my website?
faq.q1Text: Yes. Two options: (1) Paste our script like Google Tag Manager — works instantly on any site without backend changes. (2) Full server-side integration — direct backend connection for maximum control and performance. Works with WordPress, Shopify, Shopware, WooCommerce, Webflow — anything.
faq.q2Title: Do I need to be technical to set this up?
faq.q2Text: No. For WordPress and Shopify, we have plugins — just install and activate. For custom sites, it's one line of JavaScript. We handle the technical setup on our end.
faq.q3Text: Yes. We use first-party data collection. Data never leaves your infrastructure until you decide where to send it. EU data stays in EU. No third-party cookies required.
faq.q4Text: 5 minutes for WordPress/Shopify. 30 minutes for custom implementations. Most businesses are tracking accurately within an hour of signing up.
faq.q5Title: What if I'm not losing data?
faq.q5Text: Run our free data loss audit. We'll show you exactly how much data you're missing. If you're not losing data, we'll tell you — no charge.
faq.q6Text: Traditional tracking sends data from the user's browser to your analytics tools. Server-side tracking sends data from your website's server instead. This means ad blockers can't stop it, and it bypasses browser privacy restrictions.
faq.q7Title: What are first-party and third-party cookies?
faq.q7Text: First-party cookies are set by the website you're visiting. Third-party cookies are set by other websites (like Facebook or Google) to track you across the internet. Browsers block third-party cookies but allow first-party cookies.
faq.q8Text: A privacy feature Apple released in April 2021. Every iPhone app must ask you: "Allow this app to track your activity across other apps and websites?" 40% of users say "no" — breaking your analytics for all iPhone traffic.
faq.q9Text: Intelligent Tracking Prevention is Safari's privacy feature that completely blocks third-party cookies. Safari does this to protect your privacy, but it breaks your marketing analytics unless you work around it.
faq.q10Text: General Data Protection Regulation. European law that requires businesses to get user consent before tracking. Most users decline the consent banner, reducing your data by 60-80%.
